Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Stalemate \Stale"mate`\ (-m[=a]t`), n. (Chess) The position of the king when he can not move without being placed in check and there is no other piece which can be moved. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Stalemate \Stale"mate`\, v. t. (Chess) To subject to a stalemate; hence, to bring to a stand. [1913 Webster]

stalemate n 1: a situation in which no progress can be made or no advancement is possible; "reached an impasse on the negotiations" [syn: {deadlock}, {dead end}, {impasse}, {standstill}] 2: drawing position in chess: any of a player's possible moves would place his king in check v : subject to a stalemate
